meanings.definition: To force open (a door, window, etc.) with a jimmy or similar tool.
meanings.sent1: He jimmied the window open with a tool.
meanings.sent2: The burglar jimmied the lock to break into the house.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon jimmied the trash can lid open to get to the goodies inside.
meanings.sent4: Her determination jimmied open the door to new opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The rusty lock finally gave way after being jimmied repeatedly.

meanings.definition: To manipulate or tamper with (something) in order to gain unauthorized access or control.
meanings.sent1: The hacker jimmied the security system to access confidential information.
meanings.sent2: He jimmied the safe to steal the valuable documents.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky squirrel jimmied the bird feeder to get to the seeds.
meanings.sent4: Her clever tactics jimmied the situation in her favor.
meanings.sent5: The mastermind jimmied the puzzle pieces together to solve the mystery.
